element.name: Thanks, J.B.! by Hezekiah, Traditional Cache (1/2.5)

center.font: Visit the new Geocaching Ireland discussion forum HERE

long-description.p: This cache is placed near the memorial stone to J.B. Malone, who first suggested that the Wicklow Way be set up in 1963.

In addition to writing widely on walking in the Wicklow area, he also put together possibly the most comprehensive description of the Wicklow Way as a guide to those who wished to undertake the trek. He was a columnist in one of the evening papers in the sixties, outlining routes for walks
A good starting point is from the car park at Ballinastoe Woods - N 53 06.430 W 006 13.150
The location of this memorial stone gives spectacular views over lake and mountain - possibly the best views available for the least effort!

element.encoded-hints: You've probably steped on it already!

ul.li:
2010-05-02T19:00:00Z : Found it by Determo
Nice views across lough tay valley towards lough dan and turlough hill, good weather - a bit on the cold side, found the cache easily enough, TFTC (Determo & Packmule)

2010-04-29T15:08:01Z : Found it by edwincartwright
Decided to pass some other caches because they did not appear to be easily accesible from the wicklow way. This one was right on it literally. Tftc!

2010-04-23T19:00:00Z : Found it by Elvistones
The view is amazing! TFTC :)

2010-03-28T19:00:00Z : Found it by Peta Amalka
This place is adorable!!! We have been so many times to see the Guiness Lake but this place is so much better than the "car park" down there. I´m sure we will be back for a walk and enjoy the spectacular view. TFTC Out: GC

2010-03-11T20:00:00Z : Found it by kmc1112
Last Cache on our spring break visit to Ireland from Virginia, USA. Walked from Knockree to Lough Tay today on a beautiful late winter day. Enjoyed all the views along the way. TN, L pink skeleton keychain, SL, TFTC.

wpt.name: GC175RR

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
This cache is placed near the memorial stone to J.B. Malone, who first suggested that the Wicklow Way be set up in 1963.

In addition to writing widely on walking in the Wicklow area, he also put together possibly the most comprehensive description of the Wicklow Way as a guide to those who wished to undertake the trek. He was a columnist in one of the evening papers in the sixties, outlining routes for walks

A good starting point is from the car park at Ballinastoe Woods - N 53 06.430 W 006 13.150

The location of this memorial stone gives spectacular views over lake and mountain - possibly the best views available for the least effort!
